messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, any chance you can fix the regular expression used for autolinking URIs in the archives?

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:18): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, you need a pattern for <http://, specifically, see http:/ 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67oetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20070930
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:20): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, http://validator.nu/?doc=http%3A%2F%2Fannevankesteren.nl%2F2007%2F09%2Ftmb-overview
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:20): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, scope= is allowed at those points :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:20): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: wasn't when I last reviewed the schema ;-)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:21): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: anyway, I'll fix that soonish
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:21): is working on multipart/form-data support
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:22): no problem; I validated my frontpage as HTML4 and then using HTML5 override mode and it suddenly stopped validating

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:23): (just to play with validator.nu, I normally don't validate my webpages as I'm pretty sure they're always valid or are invalid because I'm doing so on purpose (testing WF2 features or something))
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:24): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: stop being so elitist ;)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:24): is fact telling elitist now? :p
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:24): hides
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (20:28): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: unhide and fix $content = preg_replace("#((https?|ftp):[^'\">\\s]+)#", '<a href="\1">\1</a>', $content); will ya ;)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:30): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, ouch
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:30): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i guess i'd like to delay some of this conversation until i find a proposal that i myself even like
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (20:30): I wonder where I copied that one from
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:30): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: because i think something reasonable may exist
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:31): and i should probably write something up to explain how it would work and why it's not bad
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:31): so people can critique that
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:31): but i agree that the current ideas are too complicated to fly
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:32): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: did you see my point about speculative future compat without nothing to test against? (in the log earlier)
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:32): i didn't understand it completely, sorry for being dense
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:33): i think for we have enough future compat in there
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:33): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, I suppose you can simply add one before that one that replaces all occurances of <http:// ...> with http:// ...
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:33): because we're ignoring everything but wairole

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:33): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: if people start publishing using a new syntax before there are consumers with native support, it is easy to accidentally build a legacy that prevents native support from ever emerging
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:34): we have that prolbem today with screen readers
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:34): JAWS provides a scripting language
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:35): and sometimes what happens, is someone develops a JAWS script that works well enough
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:35): and the app is never truly made accessible
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (20:35): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: no time now, sorry
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:35): but, on the whole it empowers the users, who get to share scripts
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:35): and it's unrealistic for every app to have native jaws support that works well enough
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:35): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: is it because the script is useful enough or because changing the app would break the script?
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:36): i would have to say usuall because the script is useful enough, but it's possible that changeing the app would break the script
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:36): 5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67, you can say that again :p
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:36): however, apps that change and get a new version break the scripts all the time
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:37): thes script-breaking changes aren't usually because someone made it more accessible
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:37): but because the app just changed
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:38): i believe that on the whole, the end user wins when they're empowered to fix things themselves, even with the risks you mention
5b67d980ae4c3c82251106e26913ce67 (20:38): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: I can :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:41): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: ok. the Web parallel is more like greasemonkey

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:42): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: not the someone deployed ill-formed "XHTML" content as text/html and thus prevented browsers from ever parsing text/html as XML
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:42): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: right, although the at script shouldn't modify the dom imo
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:46): right, like greasemonkey but readonly
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:46): doesn't modify the dom
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:47): although possibly pushes input
